subcategory: Limited Policy Initiatives by the Government to Promote Gender DEI in Organization
description: This refers to the lack of a strategic approach and commitment to gender diversity, equity, and inclusion by the government, which results in a poor national grasp of these concepts, including the representation of women in boards.

content.text: There is a lack of gender-sensitive policies and supporting infrastructure at the national level.
The lack of representation of women in government decision-making roles might lead to their needs not being adequately addressed in policy.
There needs to be a policy at the government level to start molding society to be more approving of DEI.
Diversity champions and practitioners can work with the government or policymakers to introduce reforms for the improvement of society and culture.
Government needs to make policies that create a suitable environment by deploying and passing anti-sexual harassment laws for equal chances of recruitment.
Community-level programs can be used as a step to address women's needs.
